doc.after: In copyright law a derivative work is an expressive creation that includes major copyright protected elements of an original previously created first work the underlying work The derivative work becomes a second separate work independent in form from the first The transformation modification or adaptation of the work must be substantial and bear its author s personality to be original and thus protected by copyright Translations cinematic adaptations and musical arrangements are common types of derivative works
